elements.description:
The authorization panel used in the request panel to perform
user authorization.

It is a set of forms that allow set up the authorization method for a HTTP request.

The element do not perform authorization. Depending on selected method there
are different ways of dealing with the authorization.

## Auth methods availability

By default the element renders all authorization methods available to it.

Currently these are:
- none (auth is optional)
- basic
- digest
- ntlm
- OAuth 2.0
- OAuth 1.0

The list can be changed by setting the `securedBy` property to the
[AMF](https://github.com/mulesoft/amf) security description.

Alternatively, use `iron-meta` element with `key` property set to `auth-methods`
and `value` property set to list of suppored methods.

#### Example

```html
<iron-meta key="auth-methods" value='[null, "basic", "oauth1", "oauth2"]'></iron-meta>
```

Keys can be any of `none`, `basic`, `ntlm`, `digest`, `oauth1` and `oauth2`.

Note, that if you set meta data and `securedBy` property it will use combination
of both. The base list of rendered methods is meta data list and then reduced to
defined in RAML methods. Also note, that custom auth methods are always rendered.

## Supported methods

Detailed information about authorization methods can be find in the
[auth-methods documentation page](https://elements.advancedrestclient.com/elements/auth-methods).

### Basic Authentication

The element sends the `request-header-changed` custom event to inform any other
element that is listening to this event that header value has changed
(Authorization in this case). The `raml-headers-form` is an example of an
element that is listening for this event and change request headers value
when auth data change.

### OAuth 2.0

The [Oauth 2 form](https://elements.advancedrestclient.com/elements/auth-methods?active=auth-method-oauth2)
sends the `oauth2-token-requested` custom event with the OAuth settings provided
by the user.
Any element / hosting app can handle this event and perform authorization.
ARC elements provides the [oauth2-authorization](https://elements.advancedrestclient.com/elements/oauth-authorization)
element (from the `oauth-authorization` package) that can be placed anywhere
in the DOM (from current element where `authorization-panel` is attached up
to the body) and perform OAuth athorization.

However it can be also done by any other element / app  or even server.
See `<oauth2-authorization>` for detailed documentation.


Note: OAuth 2.0 server flow probably will not work in regular browser
environment because main providers aren't setting CORS headers. Therefore the
request will be canceled by the browser.

To make it work, handle the `oauth2-token-requested` fired from the inside of this element.
If it's browser flow type (implicit) then the `oauth2-authorization` element can be used.
For other other types, handle and cancel the event and use server to handle token exchange.
The ARC elements offers a [Chrome extension](https://github.com/advanced-rest-client/api-console-extension)
that once installed will propxy auth requests and made the exchange even for
the server flow. The application should use [api-console-ext-comm](https://github.com/advanced-rest-client/api-console-ext-comm)
element to communicate with the extension.

#### `redirect-url` property for OAuth 2.0

OAuth protocol requires to define a redirect URL that is registered in the
OAuth provider. The redirect URL should point to a page that will pass the URL
parameters to the opener page (OAuth 2 panel).
If you application uses the [oauth-authorization](https://elements.advancedrestclient.com/elements/oauth-authorization)
element then it provides a popup that pases the data back to the application.
In this case your redirect URL would be `https://your.domain.com/bower_components/oauth-authorization/oauth-popup.html`.
User have to change OAuth provider's settings and adjust the redirect URL to
point to this page.

You can also use the [oauth-popup.html](https://github.com/advanced-rest-client/oauth-authorization/blob/stage/oauth-popup.html)
to build your own page.

### OAuth 1.0a

Oauth 1a is not currently supported. However, it uses obsolite hashing
algorithms and should not be used.

### Digest Authentication

When the user provide all required information for Digest authorization then
this element will fire `request-header-changed` custom event which will do the
same thing as in case of Basic authentication.

### Example

```
<authorization-panel redirect-url="http://domain.com/bower_components/oauth-authorization/oauth-popup.html"></authorization-panel>
```

### Styling

`<authorization-panel>` provides the following custom properties and mixins for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--authorization-panel` | Mixin applied to the element | `{}`
`--arc-font-body1` | Theme mixin, Mixin applied to the elements that are containg text | `{}`
`--empty-info` | Mixin applied to the element that renders no methods availability message | `{}`

Also check [auth-methods documentation page](https://elements.advancedrestclient.com/elements/auth-methods)
for methods styling instructions.

## Changes in version 2

- Renamed properties:
 - `redirectUrl` -> `redirectUri`
 - `_restoreSettings()` is not `restore()` function
- `auth-settings-changed` custom event is stopped from bubbling. Listen for
`authorization-settings-changed` event instead.

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: selected
properties.description:
Selected authorization type. It is one of the types supported by
`advanced-rest-client/auth-methods` component.

properties.name: isSelected
properties.description: Computed value. `true` when authorization method is selected.

properties.name: authRequired
properties.description:
Computed value from the AMF model.
If authorization is required by endpoint defined in the model,
then internally this property is set to `true`.

It can be `false` if `selected` is `none`, meaning RAML spec
allows no authorization.

properties.name: authValid
properties.description:
Determines if the user propertly provided authorization data into the
authorization form.

For OAuth 1/2 authorization token must be set for this to be computed
to `true`.

This property is only relevant when `authRequired` is set to true.
This status can be cancelled by setting `authRequired` to false.

properties.name: settings
properties.description:
Current settings of selected auth type.

Can be `undefined` if the user hasn't filled all required fields in the
form.

properties.name: securedBy
properties.description:
Security definition for an endpoint in AMF json/ld model.
It is `http://raml.org/vocabularies/security#security`
property of the `http://www.w3.org/ns/hydra/core#supportedOperation`
property of an endpoint.

properties.name: redirectUri
properties.description: The OAuth2 redirect URL to be set in the OAuth2 form pane.

properties.name: authMethods
properties.description:
List of currently rendered authorization methods.
This value changes when `securedBy` changes to reflect number of
authorization methods supported by current endpoint.

properties.name: hasAuthMethods
properties.description: Computed value, `true` if any method is rendered.

properties.name: noSteps
properties.description: If true then the numbered steps aren't rendered.

properties.name: customSchemes
properties.description:
List of currently available custom security schemes declared in
the AMF

properties.name: renderSelector
properties.description: Computed value. If true then type selector is not rendered.

properties.name: noink
properties.description: If true then the ripple effect on step title is disabled.

properties.name: httpMethod
properties.description: Current HTTP method. Passed to digest method.

properties.name: requestUrl
properties.description: Current request URL. Passed to digest method.

properties.name: requestBody
properties.description: Current request body. Passed to digest method.

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the state of the panel.

methods.name: _selectedChanged
methods.description:
Replaces active panel with new one and dipatches
`authorization-type-changed` event.

If the event is canceled it restores previous value in the selector.

methods.name: __notifySelectionChanged
methods.description: Dispatches `authorization-type-changed`.

params.name: selected
params.description: Current selection of the auth method

methods.name: __removeExistingPanel
methods.description: Removes any existing authorization panel from local DOM.

methods.name: __createAuthPanel
methods.description: Creates an authorization panel described as a `selected`.

methods.name: __addCommonProperties
methods.description: Adds shared properties for all panels.

methods.name: __createBasicAuth
methods.description: Creates instance of Basic auth panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: __createDigestAuth
methods.description: Creates instance of Digest auth panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: __createNtlmAuth
methods.description: Creates instance of NTLM auth panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: __createOAuth1Auth
methods.description: Creates instance of OAuth1 auth panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: __createOAuth2Auth
methods.description: Creates instance of OAuth2 auth panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: __createCustomAuth
methods.description: Creates instance of custom auth panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: __createUnsupportedAuth
methods.description: Creates "unsuppoerted method" panel.

methods.name: _computeAmfSettings
methods.description: Searches for AMF security description in the AMF model.

params.name: type
params.description: Security scheme type as defined in RAML spec.

params.name: name
params.description: Display name of the security scheme

methods.name: _nostepChanged
methods.description: Updates `noSteps` property on current panel.

methods.name: _passEventsTarget
methods.description: Updates events target property on current panel.

methods.name: _noinkChanged
methods.description: Updates `noink` property on panels.

methods.name: _redirectUriChanged
methods.description: Updates `redirectUri` property on oauth panels.

methods.name: _requestMethodChanged
methods.description: Updates `httpMethod` property on Digest panel.

methods.name: _requestUrlChanged
methods.description: Updates `requestUrl` property on Digest panel.

methods.name: _requestBodyChanged
methods.description: Updates `requestBody` property on Digest panel.

methods.name: _listAuthMethods
methods.description:
Lists available authorization methods.
By default it returns list from `supportedMethods` property which is the
list of all supported methods by this element.
If `iron-meta` element with key `auth-methods` is set then it will use
this information to compute list of auth methods.
See element description for more information.

methods.name: _listMetaAuthMethods
methods.description: Creates a listing of methods from `iron-meta` definition.

return.desc:
List of methods defined in `iron-meta`
or undefined if not set.

methods.name: _updateValidationState
methods.description:
Updates validation state for the selected form.
When element is initializing and RAML's `securedBy` property is set
during the initialization time, events with settings are fired before the form
is ready.

methods.name: _authSettingsHandler
methods.description:
Handler for `auth-settings-changed` custom event.
Sets up `settings` property from the event.

methods.name: _authSettingsUpdated
methods.description: Notifies about changes to authorization settings object.

methods.name: restore
methods.description: Restores settings to a panel including selection and data.

params.name: settings
params.description:
The same settings object as dispatched in
`detail` object from this element.

methods.name: _notifySettings
methods.description:
Notifies settings change if currently selected method is the same as
`settings.type`.

methods.name: _securedByChanged
methods.description:
A handler called when the `securedBy` property changes.
It sets up the list of available auth methods

methods.name: _modelHasType
methods.description: Checks if a model has a type.

return.desc: True if model has a type.

methods.name: _computeIsSelected
methods.description: Computes value for `isSelected` property.

methods.name: _computeSelectedLabel
methods.description: Computes label for step title.

methods.name: _clearSelection
methods.description: Resets `selected` property.

methods.name: _computeAuthValid
methods.description:
Computes value for the `authValid` property.
Authorization is valid when form panel reports it is valid and
an auth method is selected.

return.desc: True if is valid and selected

methods.name: _onAuthSettingsChanged
methods.description: Rstores authorization settings if event is external.

methods.name: _processPanelSettings
methods.description:
Processes incomming settings and acts if any action needed to authorize
the use has to be performed.

methods.name: _handleOauth2Settings
methods.description: Handles the case when OAuth2 settings changed.

methods.name: _handleDigestSettings
methods.description: Handles the case when digest auth method settings changed.

params.name: settings
params.description:
Digest auth method settings object
It can be either username and password (that will be passed to
transport method) then this function do nothing or list of Authorization
header parameters.

methods.name: forceTokenAuthorization
methods.description:
If selected authorization type is `oauth1` or `oauth2` it calls
`authorize()` function of selected panel.
If other method is selected it does nothing.

methods.name: _computeHasAuthMethods
methods.description: Computes value for `hasAuthMethods` property.

return.desc: True if at leas one methos is available to select.

methods.name: _analyticsEvent
methods.description: Dispatches analytics event.

demos.description: RAML or OAS data from AMF model
RAML or OAS data from AMF model and IronMeta

elements.name: UiElements.AuthorizationPanel

attributes.name: events-target
attributes.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Selected authorization type. It is one of the types supported by
`advanced-rest-client/auth-methods` component.

attributes.name: is-selected
attributes.description: Computed value. `true` when authorization method is selected.

attributes.name: auth-required
attributes.description:
Computed value from the AMF model.
If authorization is required by endpoint defined in the model,
then internally this property is set to `true`.

It can be `false` if `selected` is `none`, meaning RAML spec
allows no authorization.

attributes.name: auth-valid
attributes.description:
Determines if the user propertly provided authorization data into the
authorization form.

For OAuth 1/2 authorization token must be set for this to be computed
to `true`.

This property is only relevant when `authRequired` is set to true.
This status can be cancelled by setting `authRequired` to false.

attributes.name: settings
attributes.description:
Current settings of selected auth type.

Can be `undefined` if the user hasn't filled all required fields in the
form.

attributes.name: secured-by
attributes.description:
Security definition for an endpoint in AMF json/ld model.
It is `http://raml.org/vocabularies/security#security`
property of the `http://www.w3.org/ns/hydra/core#supportedOperation`
property of an endpoint.

attributes.name: redirect-uri
attributes.description: The OAuth2 redirect URL to be set in the OAuth2 form pane.

attributes.name: auth-methods
attributes.description:
List of currently rendered authorization methods.
This value changes when `securedBy` changes to reflect number of
authorization methods supported by current endpoint.

attributes.name: has-auth-methods
attributes.description: Computed value, `true` if any method is rendered.

attributes.name: no-steps
attributes.description: If true then the numbered steps aren't rendered.

attributes.name: custom-schemes
attributes.description:
List of currently available custom security schemes declared in
the AMF

attributes.name: render-selector
attributes.description: Computed value. If true then type selector is not rendered.

attributes.name: noink
attributes.description: If true then the ripple effect on step title is disabled.

attributes.name: http-method
attributes.description: Current HTTP method. Passed to digest method.

attributes.name: request-url
attributes.description: Current request URL. Passed to digest method.

attributes.name: request-body
attributes.description: Current request body. Passed to digest method.
